questions.question: What is the key characteristic of a 'well-defined collection' that makes it a set?
answers: The collection is famous.
The objects are all the same type.
It is possible to determine if any given object belongs to the collection or not.
The objects are numbers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an empty set?
answers: Set of all prime numbers.
Set of all even prime numbers greater than 2.
Set of all odd natural numbers less than 10.
Set of all natural numbers.

questions.question: Which of the following sets is finite?
answers: The set of lines which are parallel to the x-axis.
The set of months of a year.
The set of numbers which are multiple of 5.
The set of circles passing through the origin (0,0).

questions.question: If A = {x: x is a positive integer and x² < 40}, what are the elements of set A?
Let A be the set of letters in the word FOLLOW and B be the set of letters in the word WOLF. Are sets A and B equal?
answers: Yes, because they contain the same letters.
No, because the order of letters is different.
No, because the word FOLLOW has more letters.
Yes, because sets ignore repeated elements and have the same distinct letters.

questions.question: The set of all two-digit natural numbers such that the sum of its digits is 8 is given by which of the following?
If A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, which of the following statements is true?
What is the correct roster form for the set {x: x is an integer and -3 ≤ x < 7}?
If A = {x: x is a prime number and a divisor of 6}, what is the set A?
Which of the following is a true statement regarding subsets?
answers: The empty set is a subset of every set.
Every set is a proper subset of itself.
An element of a set can also be a subset of itself.
Every set has at least two subsets.
